alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Fayette; Greene; Highland; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 4:21PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN WARREN, FAYETTE, CLINTON, SOUTHERN GREENE AND NORTHERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 421 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Morrow, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Washington Court House, Wilmington, Greenfield, Blanchester, Waynesville, Sabina, Jamestown, Lynchburg, Leesburg, New Vienna, Jeffersonville, Morrow, Bloomingburg, Staunton, Good Hope, Clarksville, Harveysburg, Spring Valley, Martinsville and Corwin. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 34 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for southwestern and west central Ohio. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central, southwestern and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
